page.title: 16MY MUM'S DAY
page.content: My name is{Ruth.}We live on a hill-top farm. My mum gets up at 6.45, washes and dresses, has a cup of tea and feeds the calves. We have 29 calves. Most calves take a quarter of an hour, but one takes half an hour. Then mum prepares breakfast and takes Andrew and me to school. In the village she buys a paper, chats with Mrs. Powell and goes home. She often goes to market in Hereford, Gloucester or Mon- mouth to buy in stock. Before a snack lunch she bakes cakes and lights the fires. In the afternoon she does the housework, gardening and fetches us from school.She makes us a drink and we have a chat. Then she feeds the stock and gets tea.Afterwards Mum does some sewing, ironing or paperwork. Finally she listens to music, sees us to bed and, later, goes to bed herself and reads or does crosswords.
